gene.function: FUNCTION: Multifunctional protein working as a cell cycle progression factor as well as a cell survival factor. Required for the progression from the G1 to the S phase. Anti-apoptotic protein which functions as a caspase-3 inhibitor. Has no phosphatase 2A (PP2A) inhibitor activity (By similarity). Exhibits histone chaperone properties, stimulating core histones to assemble into a nucleosome. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20538007}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform 1]: Nucleus. Note=Accumulates in the nuclei at the S phase. {ECO:0000250}.; SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform 2]: Cytoplasm. Note=Lacks a nuclear localization signal.
geneOntologyBiologicalProcess: activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process [GO:0006919]
positive regulation of protein export from nucleus [GO:0046827]
